ctl:test.name: wcs2:req25
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req25: Send a valid GetCoverage request to the server under test and check that the response is not an exception.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:req26
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req26: Send a valid GetCoverage request to server under test which conforms to the references in the requirement. Check that the response is not an exception.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:req27
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req27: Send valid GetCoverage requests to server under test addressing existing and non-existing coverages, resp. Check if appropriate results or excep-tions, resp., are delivered.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:req28
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Req28: If a GetCoverage request contains a format parameter then this parameter shall contain a MIME type identifier occurring in some wcs:formatSupported element of the response to a successful GetCapabilities request to this server.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:req29
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Req29: If a GetCoverage request contains a mediaType parameter then this parameter shall contain a MIME type identifier of fixed value "multipart/related".

ctl:test.name: wcs2:req30
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req30: Every dimension value in a GetCoverage request shall be equal to one of the axisLabels dimension names specified in the gml:SRSInformationGroup of the coverage gml:Envelope, unless the server offers a WCS CRS extension which overrides this requirement.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:req31
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req31: A GetCoverage request shall contain at most one subsetting operation for each of the dimensions of the coverage addressed.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:req32
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req32: Send otherwise valid GetCoverage requests with matching and with violating trimming positions to server under test. Check if appropriate results are returned if and only if the requirement is fulfilled, and an exception otherwise. Pass test if all checks succeed.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:req33
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req33: Send otherwise valid GetCoverage requests with matching and with violating slicing positions to server under test. Check if appropriate results are returned if and only if the requirement is fulfilled, and an exception otherwise. Pass test if all checks succeed.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:req34
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req34: For each coverage offered by the server on hand, send a valid GetCoverage request to server under test. Check that the result validates against gmlcov:AbstractCoverage. Test passes if all individual tests pass.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:req35
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req35: For each coverage encoding format (i.e., format encoding extension) supported by the server under test: Send a valid GetCoverage request to retrieve a coverage in this format. Check that the result is a valid instance of the format indicated. Do so for both complete and subsetted coverages. Pass test if all checks succeed.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:req36
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Req36: The contents of the response to a successful GetCoverage request shall be encoded as specified in GMLCOV [OGC 09-146r2] conformance class multipart where the range set is encoded as specified by the format parameter or, in its absence, the coverageâ€™s Native Format.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:req37
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req37: The response to a successful GetCoverage request with coverage identifier id shall consist of the coverage component of the OfferedCoverage identified by id, unless the server supports a WCS extension which overrides this requirement.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:req38
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req38: Send valid GetCoverage requests to the server under test with a single trimming as the only subsetting operation. Check correctness of the coverage response returned. Do so up to the maximum number of dimensions supported by the server and for subsetting dimensions at any position in the list of dimensions. Pass test if all checks succeed.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:req39
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req39: Send valid GetCoverage requests to the server under test with a single slicing as the only subsetting operation. Check correctness of the coverage response returned. Do so up to the maximum number of dimensions supported by the server and for subsetting dimensions at any position in the list of dimensions. Pass test if all checks succeed.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:req40
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req40: Pick some combination of trimming and slicing operations on a given coverage. Construct a set of GetCoverage requests by building all permutations of these subsetting operations. Compare the results of all requests whether the result returned is identical. Pass test if all checks succeed.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:req41
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req41: When a WCS server encounters an error while performing a GetCoverage operation it shall return an exception report message as specified.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:req42
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req42: For every coverage identifier returned in a GetCapabilities response, Describe Coverage and GetCoverage requests on such an identifier shall always deliver information about the same OfferedCoverage object.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:get-kvp-core-req25
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req25: Send a valid GetKVP GetCoverage request to the server under test and check that the response is not an exception.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: [MESSAGE] The server does not support the gml coverage.

ctl:test.name: wcs:getcoverage_not_exception
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: check getcoverage result.

xsl:if.ctl:message: [FAILURE] The result should not contain an ows:Exception.
[FAILURE] The result should not contain an HTTP exception code.

ctl:test.name: wcs:getcoverage_exception
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: check getcoverage result.

xsl:if.ctl:message: [FAILURE] The result should contain an ows:Exception.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:get-kvp-core-req26
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req26: Send a valid GetKVP GetCoverage request to server under test which conforms to the references in the requirement. Check that the response is not an exception.

xsl:if.ctl:message: [FAILURE] send a valid DescribeCoverage request, and the result should contain a wcs:CoverageDescriptions.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: [MESSAGE] The server does not support the gml coverage.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:get-kvp-core-req27
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req27: Send valid GetKVP GetCoverage requests to server under test addressing existing and non-existing coverages, resp. Check if appropriate results or exceptions, resp., are delivered.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: [MESSAGE] The server does not support the gml coverage.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:get-kvp-core-req28
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Req28: If a GetCoverage request contains a format parameter then this parameter shall contain a MIME type identifier occurring in some wcs:formatSupported element of the response to a successful GetCapabilities request to this server.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: [MESSAGE] The server does not support the gml coverage.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:get-kvp-core-req29
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Req29: If a GetCoverage request contains a mediaType parameter then this parameter shall contain a MIME type identifier of fixed value "multipart/related".

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: [MESSAGE] The server does not support the gml coverage.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:get-kvp-core-req30
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req30: Every dimension value in a GetKVP GetCoverage request shall be equal to one of the axisLabels dimension names specified in the gml:SRSInformationGroup of the coverage gml:Envelope, unless the server offers a WCS CRS extension which overrides this requirement.

xsl:if.ctl:message: [FAILURE] send a valid DescribeCoverage request, and the result should contain a wcs:CoverageDescriptions.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: [MESSAGE] The server does not support the gml coverage.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:get-kvp-core-req31
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req31: A GetKVP GetCoverage request shall contain at most one subsetting operation for each of the dimensions of the coverage addressed.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: [MESSAGE] The server does not support the gml coverage.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:get-kvp-core-req32
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req32: Send otherwise valid GetKVP GetCoverage requests with matching and with violating trimming positions to server under test. Check if appropriate results are returned if and only if the requirement is fulfilled, and an exception otherwise. Pass test if all checks succeed.

xsl:if.ctl:message: [FAILURE] send a valid DescribeCoverage request, and the result should contain a wcs:CoverageDescriptions.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: [MESSAGE] The server does not support the gml coverage.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:get-kvp-core-req33
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req33: Send otherwise valid GetKVP GetCoverage requests with matching and with violating slicing positions to server under test. Check if appropriate results are returned if and only if the requirement is fulfilled, and an exception otherwise. Pass test if all checks succeed.

xsl:if.ctl:message: [FAILURE] send a valid DescribeCoverage request, and the result should contain a wcs:CoverageDescriptions.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: [MESSAGE] The server does not support the gml coverage.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:get-kvp-core-req34
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req34: For each coverage offered by the server on hand, send a valid GetKVP GetCoverage request to server under test. Check that the result validates against gmlcov:AbstractCoverage. Test passes if all individual tests pass.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: [MESSAGE] The server does not support the gml coverage.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:get-kvp-core-req35
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req35: For each coverage encoding format (i.e., format encoding extension) supported by the server under test: Send a valid GetKVP GetCoverage request to retrieve a coverage in this format. Check that the result is a valid instance of the format indicated. Do so for both complete and subsetted coverages. Pass test if all checks succeed.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: [MESSAGE] The server does not support the gml coverage.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:get-kvp-core-req36
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Req36: The contents of the response to a successful GetCoverage request shall be encoded as specified in GMLCOV [OGC 09-146r2] conformance class multipart where the range set is encoded as specified by the format parameter or, in its absence, the coverageâ€™s Native Format.

xsl:if.ctl:message: [FAILURE] Sent a valid DescribeCoverage request, and the result should contain a wcs:CoverageDescriptions.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: [MESSAGE] The server does not support the gml coverage.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:get-kvp-core-req37
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req37: The response to a successful GetKVP GetCoverage request with coverage identifier id shall consist of the coverage component of the OfferedCoverage identified by id, unless the server supports a WCS extension which overrides this requirement.

xsl:if.ctl:message: [FAILURE] the identified CoverageId is not the same as the requested one.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: [MESSAGE] The server does not support the gml coverage.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:get-kvp-core-req38
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req38: Send valid GetKVP GetCoverage requests to the server under test with a single trimming as the only subsetting operation. Check correctness of the coverage response returned. Do so up to the maximum number of dimensions supported by the server and for subsetting dimensions at any position in the list of dimensions. Pass test if all checks succeed.

xsl:if.ctl:message: [FAILURE] send a valid DescribeCoverage request, and the result should contain a wcs:CoverageDescriptions.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: [MESSAGE] The server does not support the gml coverage.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:get-kvp-core-req39
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req39: Send valid GetKVP GetCoverage requests to the server under test with a single slicing as the only subsetting operation. Check correctness of the coverage response returned. Do so up to the maximum number of dimensions supported by the server and for subsetting dimensions at any position in the list of dimensions. Pass test if all checks succeed.

xsl:if.ctl:message: [FAILURE] send a valid DescribeCoverage request, and the result should contain a wcs:CoverageDescriptions.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: [MESSAGE] The server does not support the gml coverage.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:get-kvp-core-req40
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req40: Pick some combination of trimming and slicing operations on a given coverage. Construct a set of GetKVP GetCoverage requests by building all permutations of these subsetting operations. Compare the results of all requests whether the result returned is identical. Pass test if all checks succeed.

xsl:if.ctl:message: [FAILURE] send a valid DescribeCoverage request, and the result should contain a wcs:CoverageDescriptions.
[FAILURE] send a valid DescribeCoverage request, and the result should contain a wcs:CoverageDescriptions.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: [MESSAGE] The server does not support the gml coverage.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:get-kvp-core-req41
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req41: When a WCS server encounters an error while performing a GetKVP GetCoverage operation it shall return an exception report message as specified.

xsl:if.ctl:message: [FAILURE] the result should contain a 'NoSuchCoverage' Exception.
[FAILURE] send a valid DescribeCoverage request, and the result should contain a wcs:CoverageDescriptions.

ctl:test.name: wcs2:get-kvp-core-req42
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: req42: For every coverage identifier returned in a GetCapabilities response, Describe Coverage and GetCoverage requests on such an identifier shall always deliver information about the same OfferedCoverage object.

xsl:if.ctl:message: [FAILURE] send a valid DescribeCoverage request, and the result should contain a wcs:CoverageDescriptions.
the coverage description should be equal

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: [MESSAGE] The server does not support the gml coverage.
